---
title: Special Education Snapshot Template
description: Special Education Snapshot Template Documentation
---

import Badge from '@site/src/components/badges';

**(80 Fields, 25 Collected, Delimited)**

**Target Table(s): `SPECIAL_ED_SNAP`**

| **Load Sequence/Dependency** |
|------------------------------|
| STUDENT                      |

## Template Description

This template describes the primary details of students' participation in special education in the current school year. Only students in school age programs K4 – 12 who have a valid IEP on 12/1 should be included in the December submission. The July submission should include all special education students 14 years of age or older as of July 1 of the current school year or any student who has a transition plan as part of their IEP.

## Template Specifications {#template-specs}

---
### 1 - SUBMITTING AUN
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="key" /> <Badge length={9} /></p>

The unique, 9-digit Administrative Unit Number (AUN) assigned by PDE.

:::warning[Business Rules:]
The Valid Value must equal the (Special Education) school district, the charter school where the student is enrolled (NOT educating LEA, IU, APS, CTC, or other entity).
:::

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

All LEA and School Numbers can be found on the [EdNA website](http://www.edna.pa.gov/Screens/wfHome.aspx).  

`123456789`
</details>

**eScholar Name**: `DISTRICT CODE`

---
### 2 - SCHOOL NUMBER
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={4} /></p>

The PDE defined, 4-digit code identifying the school the student attends within the district of residence.  

For Special Ed Reporting – the District of Residence should indicate 9999 for students educated in other LEAs.

:::warning[Business Rules:]
If the district of residence does not have a school with the appropriate grade level for the student (a 12th grade student whose district of residence does not have a high school), use 0000.
:::

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

All LEA and School Numbers can be found on the [EdNA website](http://www.edna.pa.gov/Screens/wfHome.aspx).  

`1234`
</details>

**eScholar Name**: `PRIMARY SPECIAL ED LOCATION CODE`

---
### 3 - SCHOOL YEAR DATE
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="key" /> <Badge length={10} /></p>

A single date (June 30), the last day of the current school year indicating the whole school year.

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

`2024-06-30`
</details>

---
### 4
Field not collected. Must be delimited in template file.

---
### 5 - PASECUREID
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="key" /> <Badge length={12} /></p>

The unique, 10-digit PAsecureID assigned to the student.

:::note
It is essential that the correct PAsecureID be entered for each student. 

**LEAs are encouraged to share this number, where appropriate and within FERPA guidelines, to ensure accurate data.**
:::

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

`1000000009`
</details>

**eScholar Name**: `STUDENT ID`

---
### 6-9
Fields not collected. Must be delimited in template file.

---
### 10 - SPECIAL EDUCATION TEACHER NAME 
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={30} /></p>

Enter the legal last name of the teacher providing the majority of the special education services.

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

`Smith`
</details>

---
### 11 - PRIMARY DISABILITY
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={30} /></p>

Enter the PRIMARY DISABILITY as identified on the Evaluation / Reevaluation Report.

:::warning[Business Rules:]
This MUST match Field 34 [CHALLENGE TYPE](docs/templates/student/student-template.mdx#34---challenge-type) of the Student Template.
:::

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

| Disability Code | Disability Description                                                                                                                                                        |
|-----------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `2121`            | Autistic/Autism                                                                                                                                                               |
| `2122`            | Deaf-blindness                                                                                                                                                                |
| `2123`            | Hearing impairment including deafness                                                                                                                                         |
| `2124`            | Intellectual disability                                                                                                                                                       |
| `2125`            | Multiple disabilities                                                                                                                                                         |
| `2126`            | Orthopedic impairment                                                                                                                                                         |
| `2127`            | Emotional disturbance                                                                                                                                                         |
| `2128`            | Specific learning disability                                                                                                                                                  |
| `2129`            | Speech or language impairment                                                                                                                                                 |
| `2130`            | Traumatic brain injury                                                                                                                                                        |
| `2131`            | Visual impairment including blindness                                                                                                                                         |
| `2132`            | Other health impairment                                                                                                                                                       |
| `2134`            | Developmental delay  **NOTE:** this code is not valid for the Special Education collection (Student/Student Snapshot/Special Education Snapshot Templates)                    |
| `2135`            | Infants and Toddlers with Disabilities  **NOTE:** this code is not valid for the Special Education collection (Student/Student Snapshot/Special Education Snapshot Templates) |
</details>

---
### 12 - SECONDARY DISABILITY 
<p><Badge color="conditional" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={30} /></p>

Enter the secondary disability as identified on the Evaluation / Reevaluation Report.

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

| Disability Code | Disability Description                                                                                                                                                        |
|-----------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **`2106`**            | **Gifted with Disability**                                                                                                                                                        |
| `2121`            | Autistic/Autism                                                                                                                                                               |
| `2122`            | Deaf-blindness                                                                                                                                                                |
| `2123`            | Hearing impairment including deafness                                                                                                                                         |
| `2124`            | Intellectual disability                                                                                                                                                       |
| `2125`            | Multiple disabilities                                                                                                                                                         |
| `2126`            | Orthopedic impairment                                                                                                                                                         |
| `2127`            | Emotional disturbance                                                                                                                                                         |
| `2128`            | Specific learning disability                                                                                                                                                  |
| `2129`            | Speech or language impairment                                                                                                                                                 |
| `2130`            | Traumatic brain injury                                                                                                                                                        |
| `2131`            | Visual impairment including blindness                                                                                                                                         |
| `2132`            | Other health impairment                                                                                                                                                       |
| `2134`            | Developmental delay  **NOTE:** this code is not valid for the Special Education collection (Student/Student Snapshot/Special Education Snapshot Templates)                    |
| `2135`            | Infants and Toddlers with Disabilities  **NOTE:** this code is not valid for the Special Education collection (Student/Student Snapshot/Special Education Snapshot Templates) |
</details>

### 13-14
Fields not collected. Must be delimited in template file.

---
### 15 - AMOUNT OF SPECIAL EDUCATION SERVICES
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={30} /></p>

The amount of special education services as identified on the IEP or Notice of Recommended Educational Placement.

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

| Code | Description                 |
|------|-----------------------------|
| `01` | Itinerant                   |
| `02` | Reserved (formerly Resource) |
| `03` | Reserved (formerly Part-time) |
| `04` | Full-time                   |
| `05` | Reserved                    |
| `06` | Supplemental Resource       |

</details>

---
### 16
Field not collected. Must be delimited in template file.

---
### 17 - TYPE OF SUPPORT
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={30} /></p>

The primary support provided to student based on their needs as identified on the IEP or Notice of Recommended Educational Placement.

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

| Code | Description                    |
|------|--------------------------------|
| `01` | Learning                       |
| `02` | Life Skills                    |
| `03` | Multi-disabilities             |
| `04` | Emotional                      |
| `06` | Deaf or Hearing Impaired       |
| `07` | Speech and Language            |
| `08` | Physical                       |
| `10` | Blind or Visually Impaired     |
| `26` | Autistic                       |

</details>

---
### 18-31
Fields not collected. Must be delimited in template file.

---
### 32 - PRIMARY PLACEMENT TYPE
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={1} /></p>

A student placed in a residential facility or group home by a non-educational agency (e.g. court systems; departments of corrections; departments of children, youth, and families; department of social services; etc).

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

- `Y`
- `N`
</details>

---
### 33
Field not collected. Must be delimited in template file.

---
### 34 - DATE EXITED SPECIAL EDUCATION
<p><Badge color="conditional" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={10} /></p>

The date the student exited the special education program.

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

`2020-12-06`
</details>

**eScholar Name**: `SPECIAL ED EXIT DATE`

---
### 35 - SNAPSHOT DATE 
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="key" /> <Badge length={10} /></p>

One of the standard reporting dates defined by PDE.

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

`2023-12-01`  
</details>

---
### 36-43
Fields not collected. Must be delimited in template file.

---
### 44 - EDUCATIONAL ENVIRONMENT
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={8} /></p>

Students with disabilities must be educated in regular public-school buildings with non-disabled students to the extent possible, as indicated in Section VIII (A or B) of the IEP.

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

| Code | Description                                                                                                                                                         |
|------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `01`   | Approved Private School (Non-Residential) 4010 Funded Students Only                                                                                                 |
| `02`   | Approved Private School (Residential) 4010 Funded Students Only                                                                                                     |
| `05`   | Public Separate Facility (Residential)                                                                                                                              |
| `06`   | Other Private Separate Facility (Residential)                                                                                                                       |
| `09`   | Hospital/Home Bound                                                                                                                                                 |
| `12`   | Public Separate Facility (Non-Residential)                                                                                                                          |
| `14`   | Out of State Facility                                                                                                                                               |
| `15`   | Instruction in the Home                                                                                                                                             |
| `16`   | Other Private Separate Facility (Non-Residential)                                                                                                                   |
| `18`   | Correctional Facility                                                                                                                                               |
| `19`   | Inside the regular class 80 percent or more of the day (formerly Special Education Outside the Regular Class Less Than 21% of the day)                              |
| `20`   | Inside regular class no more than 79% of day and no less than 40% of the day (formerly Special Education Outside the Regular Class At Least 21% of the Day (21-60%)) |
| `21`   | Inside regular class less than 40 percent of the day (formerly Special Education Outside the Regular Class More than 60% of the Day (61% or more))                   |
</details>

**eScholar Name**: `PRIMARY SETTING CODE`

---
### 45 - TRANSITION IEP STATUS CODE
<p><Badge color="conditional" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={1} /></p>

Indicate whether the student have a transition plan as part of their IEP.

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

- `Y`
- `N`
</details>

---
### 46-48
Fields not collected. Must be delimited in template file.

---
### 49 - EDUCATIONAL ENVIRONMENT PERCENTAGE (SCHOOL AGE PROGRAM)
<p><Badge color="conditional" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={3} /></p>

Actual percentage of time that students are educated in regular classrooms in public school buildings with non-disabled students as indicated in Section VIII (A) of the IEP.

:::warning[Business Rules:]
This item is not applicable to students not educated in regular buildings as indicated in Section VIII (B) of the IEP.
:::

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

`60`
</details>

**eScholar Name**: `PROGRAM INTEGRATED PERCENTAGE`

---
### 50-51
Fields not collected. Must be delimited in template file.

---
### 52 - REASON FOR EXITING SPECIAL EDUCATION
<p><Badge color="conditional" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={16} /></p>

Indicate the reason the student exited the program.

:::warning[Business Rules:]
If a student exits an LEA for any reason or is exited out of special education, there must be an Exit Code and Exit Reason. 

If a student transfers to another LEA within PA and is continuing in special education, use Reason Code `99`.
:::

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

| Code | Description                                |
|------|--------------------------------------------|
| `01`   | Graduated with Regular High School Diploma |
| `02`   | Received a GED                             |
| `03`   | Reached Maximum Age (age 21)               |
| `04`   | Dropped Out                                |
| `05`   | Transferred to Regular Education           |
| `06`   | Moved out of PA, known to be continuing    |
| `09`   | Died                                       |
| `99`   | Moved within PA, known to be continuing    |
</details>

**eScholar Name**: `PRIMARY EXIT REASON CODE`

---
### 53 - LEP STATUS (Y/N)
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={2} /></p>

This field indicates whether the student is currently identified as an EL.

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

- `Y`
- `N`
</details>

---
### 54-69
Fields not collected. Must be delimited in template file.

---
### 70 - SERVICE PROVIDER
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={50} /></p>

Enter the 9-digit AUN of the special education service provider as indicated on the IEP or Notice of Recommended Educational Placement.

If the AUN doesn't exist, enter the actual name of the service provider.
This indicates the entity providing special education services.

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

All LEA and School Numbers can be found on the [EdNA website](http://www.edna.pa.gov/Screens/wfHome.aspx).  

`100000009`
</details>

**eScholar Name**: `PRIMARY SERVICE PROVIDER`

---
### 71 - LOCATION OF SPECIAL EDUCATION SERVICES
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={100} /></p>

The PDE-defined, 4-digit code identifying the school where special education services are provided. 

If a student is at a location that does not have a designated school code, enter the actual name of the building.

:::warning[Business Rules:]
Enter the four-digit building code (when applicable). If no code exists, enter the actual name of the building. 9999 and 0000 are not valid values.
:::

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

All LEA and School Numbers can be found on the [EdNA website](http://www.edna.pa.gov/Screens/wfHome.aspx).  

`1234`
</details>

---
### 72
Field not collected. Must be delimited in template file.

---
### 73 - TRANS IEP (COMP INT PAID WORK EXP)
<p><Badge color="conditional" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={1} /></p>

Did the Student participate in a competitive integrated paid work experience?

:::warning[Business Rules:]
Required if [Field 45 (Transition IEP Status Code)](#45---transition-iep-status-code) = Y
:::

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

- `Y`
- `N`
</details>

**eScholar Name**: `TRANSITION IEP PAID WORK INDICATOR`

---
### 74 - TRANS IEP (JOB COACHING)
<p><Badge color="conditional" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={1} /></p>

Did the student participate in individual job coaching services funded by the school in a paid work experience?

:::warning[Business Rules:]
Required if [Field 45 (Transition IEP Status Code)](#45---transition-iep-status-code) = Y
:::

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

- `Y`
- `N`
</details>

**eScholar Name**: `TRANSITION IEP JOB SUPPORT INDICATOR`

---
### 75 - TRANS IEP (COMP INT EMP GOAL)
<p><Badge color="conditional" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={1} /></p>

Does the student have an outcome goal of competitive integrated employment?

:::warning[Business Rules:]
Required if [Field 45 (Transition IEP Status Code)](#45---transition-iep-status-code) = Y
:::

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

- `Y` 
- `N`
</details>

**eScholar Name**: `TRANSITION IEP CAREER EXPLORATION INDICATOR`

---
### 76 - TRANS IEP (COMP INT EMP)
<p><Badge color="conditional" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={1} /></p>

Upon exiting high school, was the student employed in a competitive integrated setting?

:::warning[Business Rules:]
Required if [Field 45 (Transition IEP Status Code)](#45---transition-iep-status-code) = Y
:::

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

- `Y`
- `N` 
</details>

**eScholar Name**: `TRANSITION IEP PAID WORK MODIFIED INDICATOR`

---
### 77-79
Fields not collected. Must be delimited in template file.

---
### 80 - RACE/ETHNICITY
<p><Badge color="required" /> <Badge color="updateable" /> <Badge length={2} /></p>

A single code indicating the race and ethnicity of the student.

:::warning[Business Rules:]
Refer to "[Race/Ethnicity: Federal Race and Ethnicity Standards](/docs/race-ethnicity-gender-standards)" in this volume of the manual for an explanation of the federal race and ethnicity codes.
:::

<details open>
<summary>**Sample / Valid Value:**</summary>

| Code | Description                                      |
|------|--------------------------------------------------|
| `1`  | American Indian/Alaskan Native (not Hispanic)    |
| `3`  | Black or African American (not Hispanic)         |
| `4`  | Hispanic (any race)                              |
| `5`  | White (not Hispanic)                             |
| `6`  | Multi-Racial (not Hispanic)                      |
| `9`  | Asian (not Hispanic)                             |
| `10` | Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander (not Hispanic) |
</details>

## Rules

See the Rules Section of the Template Domain
